docs.lead_paragraph: To sleep, perchance to... ward off Alzheimer's? New research suggests poor sleep may increase people's risk of Alzheimer's disease, by spurring a brain-clogging gunk that in turn further interrupts shut-eye.

headline.main: Studies: Better Sleep May Be Important for Alzheimer's Risk
headline.print_headline: Studies: Better Sleep May Be Important for Alzheimer's Risk

docs.snippet: To sleep, perchance to... ward off Alzheimer's? New research suggests poor sleep may increase people's risk of Alzheimer's disease, by spurring a brain-clogging gunk that in turn further interrupts shut-eye.

docs.lead_paragraph: When studies are done primarily with male animals, as is often the case, the usefulness of drugs for women is in doubt.
docs.abstract: Editorial argues necessity of using female animals for research, citing study published in journal Nature Neuroscience finding results of pain research conducted on male mice may not be as applicable to women as men; praises National Institutes of Health requirement that researchers must account for gender in pursuing their projects.
docs.snippet: When studies are done primarily with male animals, as is often the case, the usefulness of drugs for women is in doubt.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British supermodel, who stars in the movie adaptation of the John Green novel, shares more than beauty with the rebellious character she portrays.

headline.main: Cara Delevingne, Ready to Conquer Hollywood, Immerses Herself in ‘Paper Towns’

docs.abstract: Cara Delevingne, British supermodel and actress, discusses latest role as rebellious, disconnected teen in Jack Schreir's film Paper Towns, asserting her modeling career and personal angst caused her to develop deep empathy for character.
docs.snippet: The British supermodel, who stars in the movie adaptation of the John Green novel, shares more than beauty with the rebellious character she portrays.

docs.lead_paragraph: Among the recommendations by the European Aviation Safety Agency are random drug and alcohol testing of flight crews.

headline.main: European Agency Proposes Tougher Medical and Psychological Oversight of Pilots
headline.print_headline: Air Safety Agency Recommends Stricter Medical Oversight of Pilots

docs.abstract: European Aviation Safety Agency recommends number of measures meant to increase medical and psychological oversight of European commercial airline pilots, in report prompted by deliberate crash of Germanwings airliner in March; proposals are likely to face opposition from European pilots' unions and Germans concerned with privacy.
docs.snippet: Among the recommendations by the European Aviation Safety Agency are random drug and alcohol testing of flight crews.

docs.lead_paragraph: When firefighters responded to a call about smoke coming from a home in East Texas, they found the burned body of a 93-year-old woman who lived there alone.

headline.main: Texas Inmate Who's Scheduled to Die Thursday Seeks Delay
headline.print_headline: Texas Inmate Who's Scheduled to Die Thursday Seeks Delay

docs.snippet: When firefighters responded to a call about smoke coming from a home in East Texas, they found the burned body of a 93-year-old woman who lived there alone.
